docs.title: Engineering IIs — Portfolio - Hello
docs.text:
Welcome to my Engineering II portfolio. Here you’ll find selected projects, notes, and demos from the course.

Focus areas - Robotics & AI - CAD + FEA in Onshape - Statics & Dynamics - Independent research & projects

Check out the Projects tab to see examples.

docs.title: About
docs.text:
Hi! I’m a high school senior taking Engineering II. This portfolio collects my projects and learning notes.

Skills & tools - Python, Git/GitHub - Onshape (CAD), FEA basics - Robotics fundamentals - Documentation & presentation

docs.title: Hello Project
docs.text: This is a simple placeholder project page. Add images and videos as you go.

docs.title: Notes
docs.text:
• Brief problem statement
  • Approach / method

docs.title: Engineering II Portfolio — MkDocs + GitHub Pages (Student Guide, using uv)
docs.text:
This guide takes you from zero to a live portfolio site using MkDocs + Material and GitHub Pages. We’ll use: - GitHub (free hosting + repo), - Git (version control), - VS Code (editor), - uv (Python toolchain runner), - MkDocs (static site generator).

Every command that runs a Python tool is shown with uv run ..., including uv run mkdocs serve and uv run mkdocs gh-deploy.

docs.title: 0) Make a GitHub account
docs.text: Create a free GitHub account and verify your email. 👉 GitHub: Join

docs.title: A) Install Git
docs.text:
Download and install Git for your OS (Windows/macOS/Linux): 👉 Git Downloads

Set your Git identity (needed for commits): 

git config --global user.name "Your Name"
git config --global user.email "you@example.com"

docs.title: B) Install VS Code
docs.text: Download and install Visual Studio Code: 👉 VS Code Downloads

docs.title: 2) Create your project
docs.text:
Open a terminal (or VS Code terminal) and run:

# Make and enter your project folder
mkdir eng2_portfolio
cd eng2_portfolio

# Install MkDocs + Material into uv's environment
uv pip install mkdocs mkdocs-material

Initialize a starter MkDocs site: 

uv run mkdocs new .

Create folders for extra pages and media: 

mkdir -p docs/projects docs/assets/images docs/assets/videos

Replace your mkdocs.yml with:

site_name: Engineering II Portfolio
site_description: Projects and notes from Engineering II
site_url: https://<YOUR_GITHUB_USERNAME>.github.io/eng2_portfolio/

theme:
  name: material
  features:
    - navigation.tabs
    - navigation.sections
    - toc.integrate
    - content.code.copy
  palette:
    - scheme: default
      primary: indigo
      accent: indigo

nav:
  - Home: index.md
  - Projects:
      - Hello: projects/hello.md
  - About: about.md

markdown_extensions:
  - admonition
  - attr_list
  - md_in_html
  - pymdownx.details
  - pymdownx.superfences
  - pymdownx.highlight:
      anchor_linenums: true
      line_spans: __span
      pygments_lang_class: true
  - pymdownx.inlinehilite
  - pymdownx.snippets
  - pymdownx.tabbed:
      alternate_style: true

docs/index.md 

# Engineering II — Portfolio

Welcome to my Engineering II portfolio. Here you’ll find selected projects, notes, and demos from the course.

> **Focus areas**
> - Robotics & AI
> - CAD + FEA in Onshape
> - Statics & Dynamics
> - Independent research & projects

Check the **Projects** tab to see examples.

docs/projects/hello.md 

# Hello Project

This is a simple placeholder project page. Add images and videos as you go.

## Image example
![Example image](../assets/images/example.jpg){ width=600 }

## Video example
<video controls src="../assets/videos/demo.mp4" width="640"></video>

## Notes
- Problem statement
- Approach / method
- Results (data, screenshots)
- Reflection (what worked, next steps)

docs/about.md 

# About

Hi! I’m a high school senior taking Engineering II. This portfolio collects my projects and learning notes.

**Skills & tools**
- Python, Git/GitHub
- Onshape (CAD), FEA basics
- Robotics fundamentals
- Documentation & presentation

docs.title: 3) Add a .gitignore (what & why)
docs.text:
A .gitignore tells Git which files not to track (e.g., build artifacts, caches). Keep your repo clean. 👉 git-scm.com: gitignore 👉 GitHub Docs: Ignoring files

Create .gitignore in the project root: 

# MkDocs build output
site/

# Python cruft
__pycache__/
*.pyc
*.pyo
*.pyd
.env

docs.title: 4) Preview locally
docs.text:
Run a local dev server with uv: 

uv run mkdocs serve
Open the printed URL (usually http://127.0.0.1:8000). 👉 MkDocs: Getting Started

docs.title: B) In your project folder
docs.text:
git init
git add .
git commit -m "Initial MkDocs portfolio"
git branch -M main
git remote add origin https://github.com/<YOUR_GITHUB_USERNAME>/eng2_portfolio.git
git push -u origin main

👉 Pro Git Book (free)

docs.title: 6) Publish with uv run mkdocs gh-deploy (one command)
docs.text:
MkDocs’ built-in publisher builds your site and pushes it to the special gh-pages branch, which GitHub Pages serves automatically. Run:

uv run mkdocs gh-deploy

Notes: - This builds locally and commits & pushes to gh-pages. - Don’t edit files on gh-pages manually; they’ll be replaced on the next deploy. - Verify locally first with uv run mkdocs serve.

👉 MkDocs: Deploying your docs 👉 Material for MkDocs: Publishing your site

Your live site will be: 

https://<YOUR_GITHUB_USERNAME>.github.io/eng2_portfolio/

docs.title: 7) Update workflow (repeat daily)
docs.text:
1) Edit content in docs/… using VS Code. 2) Preview: 

uv run mkdocs serve
3) Stage & commit: 
git add .
git commit -m "Update portfolio content"
git push
4) Publish: 
uv run mkdocs gh-deploy
5) Refresh your Pages URL.

docs.title: 8) Troubleshooting
docs.text:
• Default Jekyll page / blank site: Re-run: 

    uv run mkdocs gh-deploy
    Then confirm your repo has a gh-pages branch with built files (index.html, assets/, .nojekyll).

  • Live site 404 right after deploy: Wait a minute and hard-refresh. Check the URL path exactly matches the repo name.

  • Images/videos not loading: Fix the relative paths (from docs/projects/hello.md to docs/assets/... is ../assets/...).

  • Git identity errors: Set your name/email again: 

    git config --global user.name "Your Name"
git config --global user.email "you@example.com"

docs.title: Quick Reference (copy/paste)
docs.text:
# Setup (once per machine)
uv pip install mkdocs mkdocs-material

# Initialize project (once)
mkdir eng2_portfolio && cd eng2_portfolio
uv run mkdocs new .
mkdir -p docs/projects docs/assets/images docs/assets/videos

# Local preview
uv run mkdocs serve

# Git init + first push
git init
git add .
git commit -m "Initial MkDocs portfolio"
git branch -M main
git remote add origin https://github.com/<YOU>/eng2_portfolio.git
git push -u origin main

# Publish to GitHub Pages
uv run mkdocs gh-deploy
